clinical_study.brief_title: Banding Without Resection in Small Subepithelial Tumours
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness and Safety of the Endoscopic Band Ligation Without Resection of ≤15-mm Subepithelial Tumours of the Digestive Tract: a Multicenter Prospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: To analyse the effectiveness and safety of endoscopic band ligation without resection in small gastrointestinal subepithelial tumours.

detailed_description.textblock:
Multicenter prospective study analysing the effectiveness and safety of endoscopic band ligation without resection in small (≤15-mm) gastrointestinal subepithelial tumours.
This endoscopic technique will be complemented with a SINK (single-incision needle-knife) biopsy for ensuring the pathological diagnosis of the treated subepithelial tumour.

primary_outcome.measure: Removal of the subepithelial tumour (initial clinical success).
primary_outcome.description: Complete removal and disappearance of the subepithelial tumour at 4-6 weeks by endoscopic ultrasonography control.

secondary_outcome.measure: Removal of the subepithelial tumour (global clinical success).
secondary_outcome.description: Complete removal and disappearance of the subepithelial tumour at 1 year by endoscopic ultrasonography control.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by American Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE) guideline.
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events, graded by American Society of Gastrointestinal Endoscopy (ASGE) guideline (Ref: Cooton PB, Eisen GM, Aabakken L, Baron TH, Hutter MM, Jacobson BC, et al. A lexicon for endoscopic adverse events: report of an ASGE workshop. Gastrointest Endosc 2010;71:446-54).
Positive definitve pathological result rate of single-incision needle-knife (SINK) biopsies permorfed in subeptihelial tumours ligated.

intervention.description: Endoscopic treatment of subepithelial tumors: autoamputation by endoscopic band ligation without resection.
intervention.other_name: Band ligation with a mucosectomy device without resection

intervention.description: To obtain sample tissue biopsies after the endoscopic band ligation without resection, performing a single-incision with a needle-knife.
intervention.other_name: Single-incision needle-knife and use of a biopsy forceps device

study_pop.textblock: Patients with subepithelial lesions (SEL) in the gastrointestinal tract.

criteria.textblock:
INCLUSION CRITERIA:
- Age between 18 and 80 years old.
- Endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) image of a gastrointestinal subepithelial tumour (SET) ≤15-mm.
- Patient capable of understanding and signing informed consent form.
- Patient understanding the type of study and complying with the follow-up of complementary tests during the study duration.
EXCLUSION CRITERIA:
- SETs >15-mm.
- SETs with clear diagnosis of EUS benign semiology: ie., lipoma, ectopic pancreas.
- Patients with multiple SETs (e.g., carcinoids).
- Vascular SETs (Doppler effect by EUS).
- Severe coagulation disorder: INR >1.5 not correctible with administration of plasma and/or platelets <50,000/mm3.
- Conditions that preclude upper digestive endoscopy, such as stenosis.
- Pregnancy or breast-feeding.
- Failure to sign informed consent form.
- Patients with functional diversity who are unable to understand the nature and possible consequences of the study, unless there is a competent legal representative.
- Patients unable to adhere to subsequent follow-up requirements.
- Patients with a life expectancy of less than 12 months.
